definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: In other words, this is an example of good and bad prejudice, right?
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，這個例子裏有好先見和壞先見，是吧？

sentences.english: In other words, this is an example of good and bad prejudice, right?
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，這個例子裏有好先見和壞先見，是吧？

sentences.english: The seer made no reply, and again and again Cao Cao pressed the question.
sentences.chinese: 先見沒有回答，並一再曹操施壓的問題。

sentences.english: The pessimists proved the more prescient.
sentences.chinese: 事實證明，悲觀者更有先見之明。

sentences.english: That is the true vision thing.
Indeed, we should note just how prescient the latter have been.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，我們應該注意到，前者是多麼有先見之明。

sentences.english: Having an intended or expected effect.
sentences.chinese: 具有預期或先見效果的。

sentences.english: No one had enough foresight to predict the winner.
sentences.chinese: 誰也沒有足夠的先見能預測哪一個獲勝。

sentences.english: Three years on, Liu's vision turns out to have been true.
sentences.chinese: 三年以來，劉的先見之明變成了現實。
撒母耳回答說，我就是先見。

sentences.english: Asa was angry with the seer because of this; he was so enraged that he put him in prison.
sentences.chinese: 亞撒因此惱恨先見，將他囚在監裏。

sentences.english: As head of the New York Federal Reserve, he was prescient about systemic risks to the financial system.
sentences.chinese: 作爲紐約聯儲銀行行長，他對系統性風險有先見之明。

sentences.english: Lamarck made an intuitive guess about the biosphere and again was prescient.
sentences.chinese: 拉馬克憑直覺推演生物圈，而且具有先見之明。

sentences.english: Poets, when they have a vision or an image, of course, use that.
sentences.chinese: 詩人，當他們有一先見或想像，當然會利用這一點。

sentences.english: Jesus anointed that Prophet and Seer.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌膏立他爲先知先見。

sentences.english: That lack of prescience is hurting.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏先見之明，帶來的是傷害。

definition: to hold back one's troops without moving (idiom); to bide one's time
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to return with thanks/to give back (honorific)
to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
